intro: Bobua formosana, commonly known as the Formosa bobua, is a species of flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
